channel.name: How the max number of AccountUpdates is calculated?

messages.content:
Where can I find the code or RFC that calculates how "expensive" the transaction is?

I have the following error for tx with 9 AccountUpdates:
```
Error sending tx Error: Error during transaction sending:

Error: The transaction is too expensive, try reducing the number of AccountUpdates that are attached to the transaction.
Each transaction needs to be processed by the snark workers on the network.
Certain layouts of AccountUpdates require more proving time than others, and therefore are too expensive.

{"signedPair":3,"signedSingle":1,"proof":3}

```

There is formula in https://github.com/bkase/MIPs/blob/66c60c48bc4d0710202f7573765ad526ca74905a/MIPS/mip-zkapps.md#fees-and-queueing
It is being used now or it is amended somehow?
Thank you! What is the difference between Signed_single and Signed_pair? How can I understand it by analyzing tx.toJSON() result?

The constants:
https://github.com/MinaProtocol/mina/blob/48888b042da0f02aabed37e35fd0c481083f43a1/src/lib/node_config/unconfigurable_constants/node_config_unconfigurable_constants.ml
```
(** limits on Zkapp_command.t size
    10.26*np + 10.08*n2 + 9.14*n1 < 69.45
    where np: number of single proof updates
    n2: number of pairs of signed/no-auth update
    n1: number of single signed/no-auth update
    and their coefficients representing the cost
  The formula was generated based on benchmarking data conducted on bare
  metal i9 processor with room to include lower spec.
  69.45 was the total time for a combination of updates that was considered
  acceptable.
  The method used to estimate the cost was linear least squares.
*)

let zkapp_proof_update_cost = 10.26

let zkapp_signed_pair_update_cost = 10.08

let zkapp_signed_single_update_cost = 9.14

let zkapp_transaction_cost_limit = 69.45

let max_event_elements = 100

let max_action_elements = 100

let zkapp_cmd_limit_hardcap = 128
```

In https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/blob/main/src/lib/mina/token/token-contract.ts#L187 is written on the number of AccountUpdates:
```
the precise upper bound is 9.
```
Using constants above I have 69.45 / 9.14 = 7.598 or 7 AccountUpdates. Can I actually have a tx with 9 AccountUpdates?
Some account updates can be handled together in a single snark
They are defined as proofless account updates
So if you have two proofless account updates they can be handled as a signed pair
But fee payer account update is handled separately AFAIU
Thank you! Understand, my tx is 0.71 above the 69.45 limit. Managed to remove one AccountUpdate, now have 8 AccountUpdates and it works.
@DFST here is how we came up with the max being 9: https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/pull/1731#discussion_r1670996014

Would be great to increase it during next hardfork to 20, as the naive implementations of the methods involving token accounts for some contracts are taking easily 12 AccountUpdates, and in cases like complex token swaps it can be even more. As I understand, the proving is much faster now than it used to be when those constants were fixed.
Arguably it shouldn’t exist at all.
I will be releasing Mina Satoshi’s Vision with 1M account update limit soon 😀
